verses.verse: So Abram <S%H87><s%> went <S%H5927><s%> up from Egypt <S%H4714><s%> to the Negev, <S%H5045><s%> he and his wife <S%H802><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> that belonged to him; and Lot <S%H3876><s%> with him.
Now Abram <S%H87><s%> was very <S%H3966><s%> rich <S%H3515><s%> in livestock, <S%H4735><s%> in silver <S%H3701><s%> and in gold. <S%H2091><s%>

And he went <S%H1980><s%> on his journeys <S%H4550><s%> from the Negev <S%H5045><s%> as far <S%H5704><s%> as Bethel, <S%H1008><s%> to the place <S%H4725><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> his tent <S%H168><s%> had been <S%H1961><s%> at the beginning, <S%H8462><s%> between <S%H996><s%> Bethel <S%H1008><s%> and Ai, <S%H5857><s%>

to the place <S%H4725><s%> of the altar, <S%H4196><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he had made <S%H6213><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> formerly; <S%H7223><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> Abram <S%H87><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> on the name <S%H8034><s%> of the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>
Now Lot, <S%H3876><s%> who went <S%H1980><s%> with Abram, <S%H87><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> had <S%H1961><s%> flocks <S%H6629><s%> and herds <S%H1241><s%> and tents. <S%H168><s%>

And the land <S%H776><s%> could not sustain <S%H5375><s%> them while dwelling <S%H3427><s%> together; <S%H9191><s%> for their possessions <S%H7399><s%> were so great <S%H7227><s%> that they were not able <S%H3201><s%> to remain <S%H3427><s%> together. <S%H9191><s%>

And there was strife <S%H7379><s%> between <S%H996><s%> the herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> of Abram's livestock <S%H4735><s%> and the herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> of Lot's livestock. <S%H4735><s%> Now the Canaanite <S%H3669><s%> and the Perizzite <S%H6522><s%> were dwelling <S%H3427><s%> then <S%H227><s%> in the land. <S%H776><s%>

Then Abram <S%H87><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Lot, <S%H3876><s%> "Please <S%H4994><s%> let there be no <S%H408><s%> strife <S%H4808><s%> between <S%H996><s%> you and me, nor between <S%H996><s%> my herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> and your herdsmen, <S%H7462><s%> for we are brothers. <S%H251><s%>

"Is not the whole <S%H3605><s%> land <S%H776><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> you? Please <S%H4994><s%> separate <S%H6504><s%> from me: if <S%H518><s%> [to] the left, <S%H8040><s%> then I will go <S%H3231><s%> to the right; <S%H3231><s%> or if <S%H518><s%> [to] the right, <S%H3225><s%> then I will go <S%H8041><s%> to the left. <S%H8041><s%>"

And Lot <S%H3876><s%> lifted <S%H5375><s%> up his eyes <S%H5869><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the valley <S%H3603><s%> of the Jordan, <S%H3383><s%> that it was well <S%H4945><s%> watered <S%H4945><s%> everywhere <S%H3605><s%> – [this was] before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> destroyed <S%H7843><s%> Sodom <S%H5467><s%> and Gomorrah <S%H6017><s%> – like the garden <S%H1588><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> like the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> as you go <S%H935><s%> to Zoar. <S%H6820><s%>

So Lot <S%H3876><s%> chose <S%H977><s%> for himself all <S%H3605><s%> the valley <S%H3603><s%> of the Jordan; <S%H3383><s%> and Lot <S%H3876><s%> journeyed <S%H5265><s%> eastward. <S%H6924><s%> Thus they separated <S%H6504><s%> from each <S%H376><s%> other. <S%H251><s%>

Abram <S%H87><s%> settled <S%H3427><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan, <S%H3667><s%> while Lot <S%H3876><s%> settled <S%H3427><s%> in the cities <S%H5892><s%> of the valley, <S%H3603><s%> and moved <S%H167><s%> his tents <S%H167><s%> as far <S%H5704><s%> as Sodom. <S%H5467><s%>
Now the men <S%H376><s%> of Sodom <S%H5467><s%> were wicked <S%H7451><s%> exceedingly <S%H3966><s%> and sinners <S%H2400><s%> against the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Abram, <S%H87><s%> after <S%H310><s%> Lot <S%H3876><s%> had separated <S%H6504><s%> from him, "Now <S%H4994><s%> lift <S%H5375><s%> up your eyes <S%H5869><s%> and look <S%H7200><s%> from the place <S%H4725><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> you are, northward <S%H6828><s%> and southward <S%H5045><s%> and eastward <S%H9506><s%> and westward; <S%H3220><s%>
for all <S%H3605><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> which <S%H834><s%> you see, <S%H7200><s%> I will give <S%H5414><s%> it to you and to your descendants <S%H2233><s%> forever. <S%H5704><s%> <S%H5769><s%>

"And I will make <S%H7760><s%> your descendants <S%H2233><s%> as the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth; <S%H776><s%> so <S%H834><s%> that if <S%H518><s%> anyone <S%H376><s%> can <S%H3201><s%> number <S%H4487><s%> the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> then your descendants <S%H2233><s%> can also <S%H1571><s%> be numbered. <S%H4487><s%>
"Arise, <S%H6965><s%> walk <S%H1980><s%> about the land <S%H776><s%> through its length <S%H753><s%> and breadth; <S%H7341><s%> for I will give <S%H5414><s%> it to you."

Then Abram <S%H87><s%> moved <S%H167><s%> his tent <S%H167><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> and dwelt <S%H3427><s%> by the oaks <S%H436><s%> of Mamre, <S%H4471><s%> which <S%H834><s%> are in Hebron, <S%H2275><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> he built <S%H1129><s%> an altar <S%H4196><s%> to the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>
